data.title: Worst Experience Ever
data.text:
7/30/2016 

Well the plan was to go watch a movie to get out of the heat but I came across an AMC theater that's ruined them all for me... The machines weren't working, there was a note on the building that said the building had no water and fountain drinks and ices weren't bein sold. When I tried to look past it and go inside to get the tickets there was a rude guy at the desk giving me the hardest time to get seats not on the first row. He acted as though he was irritated that I even tried to come in and ask about seating options   I'll be using SMG solely from now on

data.title: Fun!
data.text: They have assigned, reclining seats. Good sound, good picture.  Cute theater to check out if you are downtown!

data.title: Too cool and comfy!!
data.text: Awesome movie experience! The concession line was very fast and a great selection! I liked the self service soda fountain and Icee machine! The reclining chairs with multiple cup holders in stadium seating was just the bomb!! Almost too easy to take a nap if the movie wasn't just action packed!

data.title: Best Movie Experience Ever
data.text: Fantastic movie watching experience! The chairs at this theater are amazing, you can completely lie down and relax! The sound quality is through the roof! For people 21+ there's a full bar downstairs which makes going to movies with little ones that much more enjoyable!

data.title: Never again
data.text: Me and my son decided to try this place out since it has recliners! We got our tickets and once we entered the theater and went to the back row where our seats were located. When we went to recline they had a glass barrier on top of the half wall in front of seats. So it distorted the picture if you reclined. We though since nobody else was really in there we could move to another row. But all of them had the same thing in from of them. I don't understand why since its no different than a normal seating arrangement. Its not like the wall prevents a big fall...the next row is right there. So it was NOT worth the money. There are other theaters in the area that have recliners we will try next time! And their drinks all tasted funky. I told the lady and all she said was huh that's weird! Yap that's what I'm telling you...check your carbon/syrup!

data.title: Comfy seating!
data.text: I suggest buying tickets online where you can pick your seats and ensure you get a seat! The movies sell out quickly here as the theaters aren't as large. The first time , 2 movies sold out right as we were going to buy tickets for them. The theater is clean & the seats are electronic recliners which are super comfy to lay back in and watch a movie in. Concessions are priced high. The large drinks you get free refills on & if your in the mood, they also serve adult beverages.

data.title: Great recliners!
data.text: We haven't been to this theater in many years.  It is a very busy location but we purchased our tickets online so it was super convenient.  You can find recliners in most places now but these were really soft and comfortable.  Looking forward to another visit here.

data.title: Amazing reclining seats!
data.text: Enjoyed a movie with my family - we loved the reclining seats!  Had to pay to park, but it was a neat area in downtown Fort Worth!

data.title: Poor Customer Service
data.text: Worst AMC. Poor customer service. All they want is money. Asked the staffs to do something. They said they take care of it. It never gets done. Good example of employees apathy.

data.title: Declining reclining
data.text:
When we drove by the theatre it looked like it was closed, it was so very
dirty and unkept on the outside, no lights were on, no marquis, no sidewalk
lights, it looked abandoned.  We ventured inside where we were greeted by
a single roped off line,  a single older attendant, although very pleasant,  had a speech problem greeted us and motioned to the entrance.
We basically had to use hand signals to get information.  We had pre purchased
seats on line...the drink prices were outrageous.  The bathrooms were pretty
clean and the reclining seats were in good working condition, but this was not
my idea of an upscale movie theater,  more like shabby shabby.

data.title: My favorite anywhere!
data.text: Ok so we had to sit on the front row with three children under seven because there were no other seats to see Annie.  Well the seats are THE most comfortable ever AND they recline.  It was so wonderful, I went back with one grandchild for a second time.  A couple of weeks ago, I found myself wanting to go back to the front row for the "larger than life" experience!

data.title: Good Theater  Horrible Experience
data.text:
The seats and leg room in this theater are by far the best I have ever been in over the last fifty years.  It is reclining leather seats with electric leg lift with cup holders.  It is what you would find at a good furniture to put in your own home theater room.  The leg room at every seat is nearly double the leg room in the average theater.

This alone is the reason I score it a four.  The other issues would have made my rating a 2 or lower.  We get there with a five year old to see a 7:25 pm showing of Minions.  It still had not started by 7:50 and when it did the movie was Jurassic World 3D.  We went to find manager who was facing several similar issues in his theater at the same time.  It is to his professional demeanor and efforts that there were not people demanding their money back.  There were issues all day according to him which tells me the owner is not putting money into maintaining a quality product.

Great environment but without investment in improving quality fans will stop coming.

data.title: Great seating!
data.text: REALLY liked the power recliners to sit in! Other than that it was a typical movie theater experience.

data.title: seats more comfortable than home
data.text: out of town with some time to spare so we ran in here to see a quick movie. how nice- prices were reasonable and you got reserved seating in seats that were almost too comfortable. wish theatres in our town were as nice

data.title: Love It!!!
data.text: A little expensive but much worth it. I love the chairs and you are not squished up by weird strangers and also the chairs recline. The food drinks all good. This place is pretty cool to see a movie at!

data.title: You've come a long way AMC Palace!
data.text: I started coming to this theater since it was built almost 20 years ago.  However, after having kids, and then moving across country (and back), it's been at least 6-8 years since I've been there.  We went on a date night last weekend and I was SO impressed with how far it's come.  I love pre-reserving seats, and they were so comfortable and fully reclined. The price for what you get is great -- I'm used to Seattle with $22 tickets for this type of theater.  If you like an adult beverage during your movie, there's a cute bar on the way in.  Way to 'grow', AMC Palace!  :D

data.title: Comfy and big screens
data.text: Came here to see pitch perfect 2. Popcorn and drinks are expensive but you get free refills on both so not bad. Seats are all electric recliners, and for $9 a ticket, I'll take it haha. Screens are big and sound is spot on

data.title: Favorite movie theater
data.text: My #1 choice to watch a movie in the Fort Worth area.  Clean, extremely comfortable, and a reasonable selection of alcohol.  Their reclining chairs in the theatre room is very comfortable and aids in a great movie experience.  Also I find the movie tickets to be reasonably priced.

data.title: Aging quickly
data.text: Once the premier movie theater in town, it has not grown with time and sadly has slipped far behind.  Small theaters with small screens, conventional seating make this anachronistic.

data.title: Very Nice Theater!
data.text:
We had 4 hours to kill in downtown Ft Worth prior to catching the Amtrak train back to Oklahoma City.  We were with our 2 grandkids on a Monday afternoon and chose the new Planet of the Apes movie with a 1:30 matinee.  The theater is old and has had a wonderful renovation. 

The theater is sooo nice with a bar and large concession area upstairs.  Being an afternoon on a work day, there were only a few other people in the whole theater, but the employees were friendly and very polite despite the lack of traffic.  They served good hot, buttery popcorn and icy sodas with a smile.

All the seats in the theater are awesome, huge adjustable recliners with cup holders.  Being from a small Oklahoma town, we had not experienced these before...again Awesome!  Guess we need to get out more because our "city" grandkids rolled their eyes and laughed at us! LOL

Highly recommend the AMC Palace 9.
